item.description:
Here we have Seeder for Create Super Platform. User management all is about platform based, If your project is tenant based then your project should be created as platform, and for each tenants you can create a platform project in our user management.

  
This is the seeder which allows you to create such platform, which is responsible for the tenants which you are about to create.

item.description:
Tenant Management inclusive of the Platforms, Projects, Roles, User Types, Rights, Domain mapped urls.

1. Platform - Platform can be used as a Tenant. (But if the project requirement is having multiple tenants alone under one single entity can be satisfied by our super platform seeder. In case if the project requirements may have more than one platform, then use this platform management apis).
    
    1. Platform can have their very own Roles & Rights.
        
    2. Platform can have their very own users
        
    3. Platform should compuslory have their own user types.
        
    4. Platform can contains more than one tenants and each tenant may have separate users. (Project entity is the one which we are talking about the Tenants).
        
2. Project - Projects can be considered as a Tenants.
    
    1. Project can have their very own Roles & Rights.
        
    2. Project can have their very own users
        
    3. Project should compuslory have their own user types.
        
    4. Project can contains more than one tenants and each tenant may have separate users.
        
3. Rights - Rights Management
    
    1. Before kickstarting Roles/ User Type management, Rights should be created at must.
        
4. User Type Management
    
    1. User Type is used to group all the users in a single tenant.
        
    2. Example: I have Managers, Staffs, Administrators.
        
        1. Among these user types there is different Role users may exists, such as Administrators user type contains Admin, Super Admin.
            
        2. Managers User Type may contains different managers, Operations Manager, Project Manager, Product Manager (this can be created in role and the user type should be mapped as Manager).
            
5. Roles Management
    
    1. Roles Creation - Rights should be mapped in the Roles.
        
    2. For creating roles rights is required.
        
6. Domain mapped URLs.
    
    1. Why we are using Domain mapped urls?
        
        1. Our application url is [https://app.example.com](https://app.example.com)
            
        2. All the tenants should logging in [https://app.example.com](https://app.example.com)
            
            1. But if we are allowing tenants to use their very own domain preference then we may require to know which domain url is mapped with which tenant.
                
            2. For this purpose we definitely need this domain url.
                
            3. Mainly it should refer the frontend url.
                
        3. And if this usermanagement may used by different projects such as
            
            1. app.instance.com - It is super platform or platform
                
                1. It may contains multiple tenants (projects).
                    
            2. app.illustration.com - It is super platform or platform
                
                1. It may contains multiple tenants (projects).
                    
            3. app.example.com - It is super platform or platform
                
                1. It may contains multiple tenants (projects).
                    
            4. For this purpose we have planned to have the domain urls included with the Authentication.

response.name: member platform

item.description:
Member Management.

1. For creation of the Member it is mandatory to have the following fields.
    
    1. platform_id
        
    2. project_id
        
    3. email_id - It should be unique across the project.
        
    4. user_type
        
    5. role
        
    6. first_name
        
2. Member Platform is the unqiue id and it should be considered as user_id or member_id across the projects and platforms.
